pr_title: Save player logout times on shutdown

timeline.bodyText:
This is definitely the wrong thing to run here.
Should instead be user.cleanup() - user.dispose() will create an async task to eventually call user.cleanup, which will throw an exception. (Or should, since the server is shutting down).
timeline.author: Ichbinjoe

replies.bodyText: Ah okay, got confused on what did what :P
replies.author: JRoy

timeline.bodyText: Wrap in else and remove continue - helps convey flow.
timeline.author: Ichbinjoe

timeline.bodyText: @md678685 shouldn't this be called anyways (regardless of shutdown)? Could see instances where this isn't called on Disable due to a /reload or plugman bullshit where we lose data.
timeline.author: Ichbinjoe

replies.bodyText: stopTransaction and cleanup both run a save task on another thread, but cleanup waits for that task to complete. Running cleanup during a reload means the server will hang up while saving data for everyone, which isn't necessary. I'm pretty sure loading the user data would wait for the save task regardless, if we actually are reloading.
replies.author: mdcfe
